revised_title: Discovery of a Gaseous Compound of Carbonic Oxide and Chlorine
tldr: John Davy discovers a gaseous compound of carbonic oxide and chlorine, which reacts with ammonia to form a neutral salt. The gas is remarkable for its ability to decompose dry subcarbonate of ammonia and its power of saturation. The formation of this gas requires the gases to be in a state of perfect dryness.
